intro: Erigerodes gariepinum, commonly known as the Cape daisies, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions and is well adapted to dry conditions. Its foliage is usually gray-green with hairy leaves, and it produces small, linear leaves along the stem. Erigerodes gariepinum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
